title: 115_hr4563
content: The Act titled "Georgian Fair Business Practices Sanctions Act of 2017" requires a report on the Government of Georgia's actions that undermine commitments or agreements with US persons conducting business in Georgia. The Act "Georgian Fair Business Practices Sanctions Act of 2017" mandates the President to submit reports every 180 days on whether the Government of Georgia is undermining commitments with US businesses and to identify responsible Georgian officials. The report must also include a summary of US investments in Georgia and assess the impact of these actions. The report required under subsection (a) shall be submitted in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. IMPOSITION OF SANCTIONS ON GEORGIA GOVERNMENT AND OFFICIALS. The President will impose sanctions on the Government of Georgia and its officials if an affirmative determination is made. Sanctions include restrictions on financial assistance from the US government. The US government will impose sanctions on Georgia, including asset blocking, with exceptions for humanitarian goods and agricultural or medical products. The Trade and Development Agency funds cannot be used for activities in Georgia. The US government will impose sanctions on individuals subject to subsection (a)(2) to block transactions involving their property in the United States. Aliens subject to subsection (a)(2) are ineligible for visas or admission to the United States. The US government will impose sanctions on individuals subject to subsection (a)(2) to block transactions involving their property in the United States. Aliens ineligible for visas or admission to the United States will have their current visas revoked. The revocation of visas for aliens ineligible for entry into the US will immediately cancel any other valid entry documentation in their possession. Penalties under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act will apply to those violating regulations related to visa revocation. SEC. 4. TERMINATION OF SANCTIONS. The sanctions in section 3 will end when the President submits a report with a negative determination under section 2. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, terms like "admitted" and "alien" are defined as per the Immigration and Nationality Act. The term "appropriate congressional committees" includes specific committees from both the House of Representatives and the Senate. The term "entity" is also defined within the Act. The term "entity" in the Act refers to partnerships, associations, corporations, or other organizations, including governmental entities. It also includes a definition of "person" as an individual or entity, and "United States person" as a citizen, permanent resident alien, entity organized under US laws, or a person in the US.
